title: Unified Architecture and Unsupervised Speech Disentanglement for Speaker Embedding-Free Enrollment in Personalized Speech Enhancement
author: Ziling Huang (Shanghai Normal University), Haixin Guan (Unisound AI Technology Co., Ltd.), Yanhua Long (Shanghai Normal University), ...
relevance_why: This work significantly contributes to personalized speech enhancement (PSE) without relying on speaker embeddings, which aligns with my focus on generative approaches and voice-based applications.
background: This paper explores a unified framework for speech enhancement and personalized speech enhancement, addressing challenges related to extraction of a target speaker's voice from noisy mixtures.
contribution: This paper introduces USEF-PNet and DSEF-PNet, which unify speech enhancement and personalized speech enhancement tasks, enhancing robustness against variations in enrollment speech and improving efficiency.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often require speaker embeddings and separate architectures for speech enhancement and personalized tasks, leading to inefficiencies.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work consolidates SE and PSE into a single model that can operate effectively across various tasks without needing external embeddings.

key_innovation: The model employs a novel unsupervised speech disentanglement mechanism, allowing it to isolate speaker identity information from unrelated content.
real_world_impact: This research could lead to more efficient and robust speech enhancement systems for practical applications like personal assistants and conferencing tools, improving user experience.
limitations: While exploring long-short enrollment strategies, the effectiveness of pairing short and long enrollment speech was not consistently superior.

new_terms.Personalized Speech Enhancement (PSE): **Personalized Speech Enhancement** refers to techniques that enhance the audio quality of a specific speaker's voice in environments with multiple overlapping speakers.
new_terms.unsupervised speech disentanglement: **Unsupervised speech disentanglement** is a method for separating speaker identity from irrelevant acoustic features without labeled data.

open_sourcing: Source code and datasets will be publicly available at https://github.com/isHuangZiling/UDSEF-PNet.
